title: In the previous activities you solved few problems on searching algorithms. In this activity  also there are few more questions please answer those questions

quizDescription.text: Assume we have defined the following function:

questions.questionText: Which of the following statement(s) will result in an infinite loop?

options.feedback:
The function foo first binds val to the 0th element of L, L[0]. Then, val is bound to element L[L[0]], then L[L[L[0]]], and so on.
Calling foo on lists a and b results in an infinite loop - foo(a) traverses indicies 0->1->2->3->4->0 and foo(b) traverses indicies 0->3->4->1->0.

The function foo first binds val to the 0th element of L, L[0]. Then, val is bound to element L[L[0]], then L[L[L[0]]], and so on.
Calling foo on lists a and b results in an infinite loop - foo(a) traverses indicies 0->1->2->3->4->0 and foo(b) traverses indicies 0->3->4->1->0.
foo(c) results in an error, because L[5] does not exist.
